website_summaries.verdict: The earplugs to get for those who use them frequently and want an exceptional deal – 200 pairs that provide fit and function suitable for most consumers.
pros: Rated for protection up to 32 decibels
cons: Occasional "bad batches" didn't fit or work well
Not ideal for very loud noises
Fit is uncomfortable for very small ear canals

customer_reviews.title: These ear plugs do not completely block sound.
customer_reviews.text: I can still hear the neighbor's dog barking all night. The ear plugs are too soft (cheap foam) and do not seal into the ear canal very well. When I finally got them sealed in, I could still hear the dog barking all night long through the foam, although a bit less loud. I could not sleep. I am returning the box of ear plugs (opened of course) and hope to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Movie lover

customer_reviews.title: False product description!!!! Read review
customer_reviews.text: Product does not match description. Item is listed as 200 individually sealed bags with a pair of ear plugs in it all in a Howard light box with a pop out door for easy access. What I received was a giant plastic bag with 200 loose ear plugs in it, not paired off in bags not in the promised nice cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Pops out of my ears
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work. I read the reviews and instructions. I tried over and over but somehow foam ear plugs just move out of my ears. I tried so hard my ears started to ache. When I think they are in, I can hear like the sound of the hairs in my ears moving them out. Before I used the putty kind but they were disposable and didn't last long and never blocked out most noises. Instead of sending more kinds back, I will try the variety pack of different kinds. Sorry that I failed or they failed me. I did read the reviews first and they work for so many.
customer_reviews.author: Babag

customer_reviews.title: not effective to block out snoring
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to block out snoring, after reading customer reviews. The earplugs do not block out husband's snoring.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Milligan

customer_reviews.title: No longer a good or even decent product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if these are knockoffs or if the manufacturing process has changed but these are almost useless now. The last time I bought these they were great! Compress the plug, stick it in your ear and it would expand to block out the world. This batch is softer and does not slide in the ear the way the old ones did. When they expand, the don't fill the whole ear canal completely so the world still leaks in. These things are garbage now. Look elsewhere even if you've been happy with the product in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Azag Arcturus

customer_reviews.title: Hated them
customer_reviews.text: Hated these. They don’t block out any noise like the other ones and they kept falling out of ears
customer_reviews.author: Stamparoo

customer_reviews.title: YES!  Love them!
customer_reviews.text: My husband snores - wearing earplugs to bed every night is awful if three things happen - the first is they fall out and the second is if they don't work well and the third is your ears hurt in the morning when you take the ear plugs out. Howard Leight by Honeywell is great for all of the above. I highly recommend them! I have used many different kinds of earplugs and these are really the best!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie D

customer_reviews.title: Not Individually wrapped
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this exact same product in December and the sets of earplugs were individually wrapped, exactly what we needed. I ordered two of the exact same product just now in April and instead of receiving individually wrapped earplugs like I was expecting I received two giant bags with all the earplugs in it, meant for some type of dispenser. Returning the product and ordering from another company as I don't have time to try and reorder and HOPE they come individually wrapped as advertised. Too bad, we go through A LOT of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great initially. Foam seemed soft, and was able to get them inserted ok. Using them for sleep though. Keep waking up at 3 am... they make my ear canals ache and hurt so much I have to remove them. It’s unfortunate that I only have 195 pairs left.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - does not come in individual packets!
customer_reviews.text: Photos shown from past costumers show individual packets, which is why I chose this product over others. Extremely misleading showing as well in the product description the same deal. That description states: "Sealed Contents - The earplugs are sealed to ensure a hygienic, tamper-free, authorized Howard Leight by Honeywell product. The pop-out door allows for easy earplug access and containment."
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Gave product a 2 because though it did work to reduce external noises, initially, it just enhanced others. Must admit have "sensory overload" issues. Ambient noises that don't seem to bother other people, just irritate me. So once inserted, became very in tune with heart beating, respiration, and every time shifted, could hear the impact of my head against the pillow case. At some point removed after a few hours. Later on when woke up wanted to retest, and could still hear husband snoring from the other room.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: DON'T LIKE THEM, SORRY
customer_reviews.text: They are hard to get them right in my ears. And even when I think I've got it, they truly don't block much sound. Yes, of course, they help but compared to the 'ear-muff' type there's a world of difference. Now I've got a whole box of them. Maybe I'll use them for little floats when I go fishing!
customer_reviews.author: R.. W. P., Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed or old stock?
customer_reviews.text: This is the second box I've ordered and the quality dropped from 5 stars to one star. The foam feels dry and porous compared to the comfy first box. When you squeeze the plugs I wonder if bits of dried powder from the foam are breaking up and/or building up in my ear canal. My ears are also itchy when I use these compared to the first box. I'm not buying a third box.
customer_reviews.author: Veridian Dynamics

customer_reviews.title: A Godsend
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other brands and I like these the most. They are relatively comfortable (it is a foreign object shoved into your ear canal, after all) and stay in all night. They block most street noise, neighbor noise, and TV noise, but I can still hear my alarm go off in the morning (iPhone) and I can hear sirens, etc. Without these ear plugs, I probably would have choked out my upstairs neighbor by now. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T WORK FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: Product was soft enough but kept falling out of one ear. I totally understood the insertion process, but it did not work. Also I found that they were not as sturdy feeling as my former ones I got at cvs, which fit much better and provided more silence. These new ones were much more lighter in weight & flimsy in my fingers. From the reviews I read, they really sounded great. But I will stay with my old brand which, if I remember correctly, were a bit more pricy. I hope this wasn’t a case of ‘you get what you pay for.’
customer_reviews.author: CINDYLOU

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit well in the ear and kept coming out.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these didn't work for me. I tried different ways of inserting them in my ear but they kept falling out. I wanted something that's easier to insert, comfortable and noise reducing. For me, the mack's ultra soft ear plugs from target worked better. They are comfy and stay in my ear. I bought these after reading the positive reviews but, these were not the right ones for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zofshan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Good and comfy! Used one box up after 7 years, bought another
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs deaden more sound than any other plug I've used. They're comfortable enough to wear without noticing they are there for hours on end. I keep some of these just about everwhere. I use them for sleeping in noisy environments and keep with my travel kit. They're great for traveling when staying in hotels next to highways or airports. Work great for camping to block out unusual noises. Especially useful for yardwork and around power tools. I use these in combination with over ear protection while at the gun range. Makes being around high caliber rifles with muzzle breaks tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mount

customer_reviews.title: Did these change??
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these earplugs for years to drown out my husband’s snoring as much as possible. They still look and feel the same but in the past few months they don’t seem to work as well. Now I can still hear my central air (never could before) and they no longer drown my husband out as much as before. They never silenced him completely but at least I could sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Regan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, exactly what I was after for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: My wife thinks these are a little large, but I think they're great. I carry them as spares with my shooting gear in case someone I'm with doesn't have ear protection. My wife also uses these the suppress my snoring when it bothers her. And occasionallywe both wear them at concert events. Good to have a large supply on hand, these should last quite awhile and at a reasonable price. (Unlike other reviewers, this product came to me as advertised... box of 200 individually packaged baggies with a pair of plugs in each)
customer_reviews.author: Matt Foster

customer_reviews.title: IMO, the DB rating is a bit higher than it should be?
customer_reviews.text: These are the roll between your fingers type of ear plugs. I use loud equipment and tools on a daily basis. I do not think the DB rating on these is correct. I used all the ear plugs I had from another manufacturer and those were rated 34db as well. There is a noticeable difference between these Howard Leight's and those. Those made the noise quieter than these do. In fact ,I now I also wear ear muffs to compensate when I wear these Howard Leight ear plugs. They are okay but not as quiet as I was led to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE THE EARPLUGS YOU ARE LOOKING FOR
customer_reviews.text: I have small ear canals, so basically all earplugs HURT to wear. I used a pair that looked like these ones once at iFly, and they actually did NOT hurt my ears. I figured these might be the same ones, and they are!! These squish really well and fit right into your ears. I wake up with no ear aches! Hallelujah. Might as well get the huge pack; I bought the 200 pack and give them out to people. (Also I tend to lose my earplugs, so it's nice to have replacements.) Each pair is individually wrapped, so you can throw a handful in your camping supplies and have a clean pair whenever you need them. GET THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Dye

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have tried most of the other ear plugs & ordered these because of the low price & great reviews. I can say that I am not impressed. I really don't notice a difference. They work but are difficult to get in right. I have the same problem with all the others. Best thing about these is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: Ear plugs are of such a personal nature. One size really doesn't fit all, at least to ones own likening. But these are perfect for me. I worked for a construction company at one time. And they carried an assortment of different brands of ear plugs. This was one of the brands they carried, my favorite! I now ware them to mow, weed wack and blow grass clippings with. They do a good job at stopping noisy equipment. My ears ring and I am trying to save what hearing I have left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: BEST ear plugs I’ve ever tried!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used ear plugs to sleep for years. These are the BEST I’ve tried! Expand evenly when inserted in the ear. With others, I usually had to turn at least one ear plug once they expanded because it didn’t form to my ear correctly... you know what I’m talking about. I haven’t had to do that once with these! They block out a good amount of sound. Obviously, they’re not magic plugs that eliminate sound completely, but they’re pretty close. Throw in a fan to help drown out the background noise, and gooooooood night!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: These things don't work. I had the standard bell shaped ones for years to sleep with. They worked fine. These are too small for me and my wife's ears (she has small ears). When you roll them between your fingers to insert in your ears they fold up and don't block sound well. It's like the are not dense enough. Go for the bell ones. I was going to send my box of 200 back but I missed the cut off by a day. I'm tossing the 200 out. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mo

customer_reviews.title: Most comfy earplugs to sleep in!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing earplugs to sleep for 8-9 years and these are by far the most comfortable ones I’ve used. I can reuse them for a week or two and have no issues. I throw them away after they don’t roll up as easily, but like I said, you get a lot of use out of them before that. I can still hear my hubby’s snoring a little bit, but they’re comfortable, even on my side. I can’t sleep without them now and these ones are as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: 25 years experience says these are the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing earplugs to sleep every night for 25 years, going through many different options - this is by far the most comfortable. They're not too large, they're soft and pliable but expand well to fill the ear canal so are effective. I won't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Torn
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they are light weight, more comfortable than others, and provide enough noise reduction without the headache of the pressure of being too tight. With that said, I don’t think I have a long ear canal unlike regular humans and for me to get the long part in my ear till it hits the wider part (“the stopper”) that blocks noise, it feels like it is hitting my ear drum. Obviously it isn’t but it is a little uncomfortable.. like it is hitting something. Still like them enough since they do last for almost two weeks with nightly use before they start becoming less effective.
customer_reviews.author: Clearblueskies

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how much noise these things cut out
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how much noise these things cut out. Used them at the monster truck race, around jet engines, in piston engine aircraft (under my headset, on a long flight through nowhere), while woodworking, and while doing yard work. I don't know why I haven't bought these before! My ears don't ring anymore after long flights, and I don't have that odd period of readjusting to not having a constant noise around me. Only downer, if you can cal it that, is I can't hear normal conversations very well with them on, so if I'm interrupted while doing yard work I have to pop one out.
customer_reviews.author: just bought this

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice, 3-5 night usage on average
customer_reviews.text: I've preferred this style of earplug for years but all pink/yellow earplugs are not created equal, I have found. These have that satisfying fade-to-silence when you put them in. I slept through a rather loud thunderstorm not long ago wearing these. Since I wear earplugs daily I reuse them as long as I can. I can get 3-5 nights on these, sometimes more if I don't need total silence (it's harder to put them in fully as they get used). The individual wrapped bags are nice for travel. The tough plastic doesn't but is made of a rather tough plastic and not the easiest to open; a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Dalessandro

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my ears after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in August and it’s now December so 4 months and now I’m unable to use them. I sleep with them every night because unfortunately I am a very light sleeper and I can’t sleep if I hear noises for the most part. Initially they were comfy, hard to stay in my ear sung enough, but soft to were there did not irritate my ear. Now they are hurting my ears while I sleep so I can’t wear them. Too late to return them so I’m stuck with a huge box of ear plugs I’ve only used 7 pairs out the 200 count :(
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: The only earplugs I will ever use!!
customer_reviews.text: I wake up to every, single, itty-bitty noise and it's annoying! I sleep with a noise-cancelling fan on at night, but once in a while need earplugs as well, especially when I travel or if my kids have friends over for a sleep over, etc. These earplugs work great and are super comfortable. My 13-year old daughter uses them now as well because she has trouble sleeping through noise and she loves them! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alyandoly

customer_reviews.title: Oh well
customer_reviews.text: Every single of them is different size.. literally. I just tore ten new packages looking for the right one to fit my ear. Bad. Just bad. Low quality stuff. I feel like these reviews are fake under this product. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Bakoo

customer_reviews.title: They Work!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several brands of foam, silicone and wax based earplugs. I’ve used these for a week so far, and they are definitely the most comfortable ones I have tried and do a good job of reducing noises so I can sleep soundly. I am a side sleeper. Other types put too much pressure on my ear and I have to remove them after a few hours. These remain comfortable. Since they were so inexpensive, I only use each pair 2 nights, then use a new pair. They probably would last longer if I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Razz Berry

customer_reviews.title: For the price, a great deal
customer_reviews.text: I use these when range shooting, even wearing them in addition to over-the-ear headphone sound suppressors. I also use them for extended riding on motorcycles, where wind noise inside the helmet can make your ears ring at the end of a medium to long ride (definitely not good in the long run). They're comfortable enough to use at night while sleeping, for the times when background noises would otherwise likely be intrusive and sleep-interrupting (dogs barking, thunder, etc.). While these may not be quite as effective as the fancy, state-of-the-art noise-cancelling earplugs, you certainly can't beat these Howard Leight earplugs for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BAK

customer_reviews.title: Great product but some don’t go in as easy
customer_reviews.text: Overall these things are great. However I find that some don’t stay compressed when rolling them and immediately bounce back. If this happens just grab another pouch and try again. Most hold their shape fine. Attached is a demo of one that doesn’t stay compressed vs one that does.
customer_reviews.author: modex

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy for work at home!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small ranch where my bf loves to play music while he works, have all phone conversations by speaker phone at the highest volume, and ask me where things are at all times. These ear plugs block out all noise unless he's trying to still speak to me face to face where I point to my ears and pretend like I can't hear a thing. Works like a charm. Make sure to fully roll to its skinniest size and wedge all the way in your ear as it expands to its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: nadia

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for - these are cheap knock-offs of what you see in your local store.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same quality as the ones at the local drug stores. These are definitely a knock off or manufactured in a different way to enable this kind of price point. They don’t fit well, don’t work well to block my husband’s snoring like the “regular” ones from the local drug store, and sometimes even hurt my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Anupa

customer_reviews.title: These are the bomb
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing earplugs to sleep most of my adult life (and I'm 70). These are the best I've found: soft, comfortable, and very effective. One thing I really like: there's been a recent change in materials by a lot of manufacturers to produce earplugs that can only be worn a couple of times before they harden up and hurt your ears. I guess they can sell more that way. These do NOT do that. You can wear a single pair for a week or more.
customer_reviews.author: Aster Brun

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable a good wind noise protection while motorcycling
customer_reviews.text: These work well for me. I use ‘em while motorcycling to help preserve the hearing I have left. Comfortable for hours at a stretch. The trick is to figure out how to get them to seat in the ear canal so that they’ll seal. Took me a while to get the technique right. Now they go in perfectly every time. I have custom audiologist-fitted ear plugs. For me these are more comfortable and seal out the noise better than the custom ones. I keep a bunch on the bike, so I always have fresh ones handy. I use them for a day or two, then toss ‘em.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great when you have a snoring partner
customer_reviews.text: I first discovered these earplugs a few years back on a job and thought they were great. Fast forward a few years and I find myself a boyfriend who is also great, but snores so bad that I need to sleep with earplugs. If you have a snoring partner, these are for you. I have tried other cheap earplugs but they hurt my ears and are so uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time. These do none of that. They are worth the price and I will continue to order them. Plus for the amount you get, you should be good for a while
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: The good kind.
customer_reviews.text: These are the good kind of ear plug. Perfect because: They roll up nicely for insertion (dont "inflate" to quick to get them seated) but also don't take too long to "re-inflate" once in the ear.They have that kinda tacky texture that allows to seal in the ear canal. They block sound perfectly and are comfortable. These are ideal so you won't be sorry you bought!
customer_reviews.author: N-A

customer_reviews.title: Not for small ears...
customer_reviews.text: Despite the claim to "fit virtually any ear canal" I have a very difficult time getting these to fit my small ears. I really have to work with them for a few minutes to get them to stay. Once they are adjusted right they work very well. But sometimes it's too frustrating and I just go without. Bought to help drown out my husband's snoring. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rambling Annie

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs made me ears hurt after waking up in the middle of the night from having them in my ears for 4 hours. I’m guessing they cause too much pressure on my ears when they expand and this was the issue. I would not recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nel

customer_reviews.title: Best earplugs on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I used these earplugs every day for close to a year at my old job, which was in an extremely loud metal finishing plant. Not only are they super comfortable—to the point where you forget that you are even wearing ear protection—but they cancel 90% of any noises around you. I now use them for sleep and meditation; they are fantastic for both uses. They're relatively cheap too, which a great plus.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Not the best earplugs I've used...
customer_reviews.text: I usually order 3M Classic earplugs in 100 pack boxes, but decided to give these a try since they were cheaper. I guess you get what you pay for, as these are not nearly as impressive...much lower protection offered, harder to get tightly into my ears, and kind of gross feeling, almost slimy. I think I will go back to my long term use of the 3M Classics.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Cogburn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They barely fit into my ears, they’re way too big. There is very little noise reduction once I finally get them into my ear. I can still hear my fan on low while wearing them :/
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: The best one time use ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: I'm a super light sleeper and have tried on at least 30 different types of ear plugs, and found these to be the most effective for me. Each pair comes in its own pouch, the earplugs are easy to insert, they don't come out of my ears while I toss and turn in my sleep, and they never hurt my ears the way some do. This is the second time I've purchased these, so I've gone through hundreds! I kind of wish there's a way to recycle them though.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C

customer_reviews.title: Some damaged
customer_reviews.text: These are fine, but sometimes you get a pack where they are all shriveled you and you can’t use them for your ears. They work well when they aren’t a damaged pair, but some packs come damaged in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Suzears

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for pretty much any use.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, convenient and do an excellent job of negating excessively loud noises while still allowing you to hear. I use these for woodworking today, but these are the same earplugs we used in the shipyard. When you have a 10 ton steel plate fall onto a steel roller and have all the stiffeners break off and go flying while your 50 feet away and you don't go deaf and the person standing next to you says "wow, someone's in trouble" and you can hear them, then you have the perfect amount and range of noise reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 30+ years of using earplugs  - these are the best.
customer_reviews.text: 30+ years of using earplugs for shooting and these are the best. Best in class for comfort, noise level reduction, and ease of putting them in my ear. You just have to try them to understand. They come packed in individual pairs inside the box (I ordered the 200bx). But why pink? Why not yellow and black or yellow and blue? :)
customer_reviews.author: D. GIUNTA

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfortable AND they actually work!
customer_reviews.text: Love these earplugs!! My husband has gotten them elsewhere and has used them for various events for years and I use them often to sleep while he snores. He ran out so I tried others, supposed to be for sleeping, and they were SO uncomfortable! Finally found them here and I am so glad, soft, comfortable AND they work!! Didn't realize I selected the 200 pairs option, the price was fantastic, so I am well stocked for quite some time. But will definitely order again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy K

customer_reviews.title: Yellow and Pink Earplugs
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for these earplugs for years. No others compare. I somehow spotted them on Amazon and felt the price was well worth the find. The quantity is alot but I share with family and have them available for overnight guests. These are the most comfortable earplugs and I've tried many. Was thrilled that I finally found them.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Gal

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get into ear canal.
customer_reviews.text: Hello! Well, I seldomly write reviews, but I thought that everyone else purchasing these should know what I had to discover when they arrived. People who have to wear these every day know what a pain in the rear plugs that are too SOFT react to squishing, rolling, then placing them in the ear canal. I had to fight with these plugs to get them in my ear. More rigid plugs get into the ear MUCH easier than these. Once they are in there however, the do a great job. If you are annoyed by how long earplugs take to get in to your ear canal, look for different plugs. These ones are just far too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Soft, snug, durable, and effective. I'm hooked!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a weirdo...I know I'm not the only one! I sleep with earplugs every single night. They are required for me to have a snowballs chance in a Texas summer of sleeping at night. These are AWESOME! They fit snugly and softly in my ears, block out most sound, and don't irritate me after a night of usage. I can not stress how soft they are. I love that I was able to get so many pairs, each individually wrapped, for such a low price. Although it is never recommended, they are durable enough to hold up for multiple uses. I even love the bright, neon colors. I'm hooked! This is my go-to brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Good for some applications
customer_reviews.text: They are soft and very comfortable but they just dont work well for serious needs. You have to use the fat and for shooting or at work and even then they just dont drown loud noises very well. Oh and another thing, they stink really bad. Like funky old fish.
customer_reviews.author: boltsfan52

customer_reviews.title: but it does not feel like the other Howard Leights i've used
customer_reviews.text: So far only used one, but it does not feel like the other Howard Leights i've used. these compress and stay compressed much longer. the old better ones would compress and almost immediately grow back to standard size. Still did well with noise cancelling though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: According to the other reviewers, these are great for sleeping. I wouldn't know, but I can tell you that they're great for chainsaws. I run powersaws most days for hours on end and these are some of my favorite earplugs. They're soft and comfortable and isolate well from the high-pitched sound of high-performance two-strokes, but you can still talk to your cutting partner if you just raise your voice a little bit. I go through a pair every day or so. Keep multiple pairs stuffed in your pockets, change often and protect your hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft, quiet and stays in
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my home. Snow blowing, mowing, using power equipment, sleeping and on the plane. I have used and tried many earplugs and these are the best. They are soft and they stay in while sleeping or working around the house better than any I have tried. This big box will last a bit but allows me to change them out often which should be done anyway. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BLOCK OUT SOUND
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I ordered these, but I found that they didn't work for me at all. I tried several times and they didn't block out enough sound for me. I think the description is misleading. I purchased them just for sleeping so I can't believe any worker would find these sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Z

customer_reviews.title: Save your money! Do not cancel sound well.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought ear plugs that looked like these at the drugstore a long time ago. When they filled out inside the ear the sound disappeared. These barely make a difference. They look the same but don’t work the same.
customer_reviews.author: jewely

customer_reviews.title: Better than some
customer_reviews.text: They are better than some of the ear plugs have used because they're slightly more comfortable, but the noise cancellation isn't great. I use them to block out noise when I'm sleeping because I'm a fairly light sleeper and I still find that even little noises through the night will wake me when I'm wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable value
customer_reviews.text: 200 pairs? Whoever is selling these things is a saint. They come individually packaged which feels a bit wasteful when they're already in that big box, but these plugs are amazing for the value. They're not cheap garbage, they compress and expand well, even in high heat. I use them in my shop all the time and double them up with cans for the shooting range.
customer_reviews.author: John Bazzetta

customer_reviews.title: The cord broke off after first use
customer_reviews.text: The cord broke off after the first use. I spent extra money to buy these just because it has the cord but the cord doesn’t work so it defied the purpose. I wouldn’t recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Luxi Meng

customer_reviews.title: Best earplugs.
customer_reviews.text: I ride motorcycles and have been using these for many years. Even for sleeping occasionally. I've tried lots of different kinds over the years and even custom ones. These are hands down the best for me. The key is to squish them by rolling between the fingers and inserting them fully within the ear before they expand. They are inexpensive and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Upperquay

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them
customer_reviews.text: So I actually bought my first box over two years ago! That’s how long this entire box has lasted me. Honestly these earplugs are the best I’ve ever bought. They are comfortable and the best for noise cancellation. I wear these to bed almost every night since I’m a light sleeper. As soon as I put these in, it’s pure silence and I’m out in 10 mins. Best product yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara

customer_reviews.title: the Best.
customer_reviews.text: I have a really noisy roommate who stays up late with friends on a regular basis, and I wasn't able to sleep comfortably during the week. These were the only thing that helped. I've never had a reason to try earplugs before but these were perfect. They stayed in my ear, blocked out EVERYTHING and felt comfortable. I like that they're bright because when I dropped one I was able to find it easily. I was able to get about three uses out of each pair before I threw them out. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Poorer Honeywell quality.  Look for same product made by Sperian
customer_reviews.text: Warning: There are apears to be two manufacturers of these earplugs (at least). I have been using Sperian for years and they are great. This product is made by Honeywell and appears to be inferior quality from poorer quality foam to incorrect location of the perforations to drab dispenser box printing. A very poor showing for a product I thought I loved. I will be looking for Sperian specifically next time.
customer_reviews.author: Greenapple

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, even quiter than other ear plugs...
customer_reviews.text: This product is comfortable and reduces sound very well. I have very sensitive hearing after an accident. I have to wear ear plugs very often. I buy them by the large box, like this often. These plugs are noticable quiter than any ear plug I have ever used. I often have to use these plugs for extended periods of time and they are as comfortable as any I've ever used. I will be repurchasing this product and I strongly recommend this for anyone who finds the need for comfortable hearing protection...
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: if you like to shoot
customer_reviews.text: Buy these. Buy the whole big box of these... if you like to shoot, work in a loud environment, play with power tools, ride a motorcycle, go to rock concerts, play in a metal band, block out your kids, sleep during the day, sleep during building demolition next door, etc. They work. Just the right cushion, just the right color to go with your early 1990s fashions. The best part is you get a WHOLE GIANT BOX of these things... individually packaged. Great last minute party favors or to hand out to fellow airplane passengers if you are the parent of a screaming baby.
customer_reviews.author: Chester A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Earplugs
customer_reviews.text: As a professional guitar tech for a national touring band, I wear earplugs all the time. What I’ve noticed is some brands work better for me than other brands. It’s not possible to say what brand works best for you since we all have different ears but these work excellent for me. What I like is the softness of these plugs. They quickly expand and seal the ear canal quickly and do a great job blocking loud noise. I highly recommend these earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I use earplugs every night when i sleep because I'm a very light sleeper. A single jiggle of the doorknob will wake me. With that said I've purchased a lot of different ear plugs. These are just a comfy as any other brand and for the cost and quantity they're a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: The Best! Never buying another brand again!
customer_reviews.text: These are legitimately the BEST noise canceling ear plugs I have ever used! I won’t buy another brand ever again. They drown out everything from my husbands snoring to my dogs barking. If you need a good nights sleep, peace and quiet, highly recommend. They’re super way to put in and do not fall out. They stay in all night and are very easy to remove. Really soft on the ears too.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha H.

customer_reviews.title: You only get one set of ears.  Protect them!
customer_reviews.text: I wrecked my hearing as a kid going to loud concerts. I only wish I had taken the advice of my elders and started using foamies sooner. They protect your ears AND make the shows more enjoyable by cutting down on noise, letting more music in. Can't be happier - will definitely buy more when these run out!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palkovic

customer_reviews.title: Works great for sleeping and shooting
customer_reviews.text: Great value. I use these for sleeping and shooting (in the ranges that allow earplugs). In the shooting range I find that when properly inserted these are more effective than muffs, and they don't get in the way. I've probably purchased 5 of these boxes in the last several years and I've had no issues with defects. I'm not sure what the official position is on re-using them, but I'll frequently use a pair for sleeping for 1-3 nights. If they fall on the floor or otherwise get dirty, I replace them. They start to lose their "spring" after the first use, so if you're using these for shooting it's probably best to go with a fresh pair.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kranyec

customer_reviews.title: Best earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I wear earplugs to bed every night. I don’t use a new pair each night because you don’t have to. This was a big box at a very economical price. Each pair is individually wrapped. If it is too humid the earplugs will get too mushy to be able to squeeze tightly to get them to fit properly. I just open up a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been sleeping with these ear plugs for 20+ years. The best I have found. Excellent for mowing grass and woodworking in garage. May seem like a lot of money for a box, but I get about 4 years; 1 pair a week, from each box. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: I love these.
customer_reviews.text: I had used them before at the gun range and at racetracks. They are easy to use, comfortable and effective. I bought this big box of them to have handy for lawn mowing and noisy garage jobs. (Grinding and cutting steel, etc) Having handy individual packages is everything I hoped for. Ready to go. Easy to grab. Always clean and fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Top-Quality Soundproofing!
customer_reviews.text: The best earplugs I’ve ever used! My husband’s snoring is so bad I have to wear these every night. They are easy to mold and don’t dry out as quickly as most, so you can reuse them more comfortably. Something about the shape makes the soundproofing so much better as well. I was a little surprised to find that they came individually wrapped though. A little annoying, but a small price to pay for a good nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Rosilyne

customer_reviews.title: Too big and not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: These were too big for my ears and I was unable to return them even though they are packed individually in pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Margpie

customer_reviews.title: Don't Block Out Husband's Snoring
customer_reviews.text: They didn't work to block out my husband's snoring. ALSO - IF YOU ARE A SIDE OR STOMACH SLEEPER, they will hurt your ears from the pressure your head on the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Love these. They fit all sizes (I have smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They fit all sizes (I have smaller ears and they fit great, not uncomfortable). I'm sensitive to loud noises so I like the individually wrapped packages that I can stash everywhere...work, purse, car, etc. the strap is nice too so you're not losing them. I used on all deployments, working in the yard and with loud-talkers at work. The best disposable ones I've found so far!
customer_reviews.author: sweetsue247

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice when riding motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the positive reviews and am very glad I did. I used them yesterday for the first time on a day long motorcycle ride and these are the best ear plugs I've ever used both in terms of noise reduction and comfort. I wish I had discovered these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G. Wills

customer_reviews.title: Used these for over 17 years.
customer_reviews.text: Used to work on the flight line and used these because work purchased them. When they switched suppliers to the yellow porous foam plugs I promptly just started buying my own laser light ear plugs. These things are seriously the best at blocking out noise, providing all day comfort, and just simply being amazing at what they were designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: Sure is a big box! I only needed a few pair for riding motorcycle but could not find just a few pair so I got this giant box. The rubber kind kill the inside of my ears and stick out which you cannot have in a helmet so these foam ones are the only option. I wanted them stringed so I dont drop them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love these! One box has lasted me three years!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these because my husband snores. They work really good. They hurt my ears after a while but not sure if they are meant to wear overnight. I bought this on March 1st 2017. It is now April 12, 2020 and I just reordered! I didn't use a new pair everyday but three years is a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Burdsall

customer_reviews.title: Work great - individual packacking is a huge plus
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs have worked very well for me. I've been using earplugs for years mostly to sleep (often at home as I live in a busy area), but also while traveling, working, and shooting. These are the best earplugs I have used yet. Another huge benefit of these is that they're individually packaged. Whenever I take a trip with friends I throw a handful in my bag and usually end up giving away a few pairs. Obviously people appreciate the fact that my hands haven't been all over something they're going to put in their ears. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Williams

customer_reviews.title: what i have been looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly the type I have been looking for. My others I was using until they were not functioning as they should. But they were still more comfortable and cut sound better then any type. I am so happy to have found these on Amazon and now have a supply
customer_reviews.author: Their Nana

customer_reviews.title: The best "foamies"
customer_reviews.text: After trying several types of hearing protection these are my go to earplugs. I like that they come packaged in pairs individually so I can throw a few sets in a glove box or bag. They are always soft enough to easily mold and the NRR of these is great. They are comfortable and I use them several times a week. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ODCaveman

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy anything else.
customer_reviews.text: Sweet baby Jesus these are great...soft, comfortable, and wide enough that they fit really well and provide some of the best sound blocking I've ever had from a disposable ear plug. Best value for the money I've found, by far. Great for motorcycling and sleeping! Edit: I slept an hour and a half past my alarm with these, that's never happened before... they're that good.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These are still good ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: I greatly prefer the Howard Leight Max ear plugs mainly because I can get a couple months worth of use on them. These are still good ear plugs, they do a good job of blocking out loud noises. I use these at the library and they work great! My only gripe is, I know they are single use only but they don't last that long. I could use Howard Leight Max ear plugs for a month or more and they still kept their squishyness.
customer_reviews.author: Justina Chen

customer_reviews.title: Best ear plugs out there
customer_reviews.text: I used to do some work at a facility that had these at times. I finally broke down and looked for them on Amazon, found them and ordered a case for my use at home/etc. I do a lot of consulting work at industrial sites that require hearing protection, so it's very convenient for me to just have my own.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Buy another product
customer_reviews.text: I have a very hard time getting these in my ears and a hard time getting them out. If I do not fuss with them when I put them in they do not keep noise out. Sorry I bought them. Same maufacturer however work much better
customer_reviews.author: J from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Best plugs I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Pears are individually packaged. Nice touch. I use these plugs to help me sleep better. They're easy to put in and I like the fact that they don't hurt my ears when I wake up in the morning as some other pugs have. They also don't fall apart as easily as some of the orange shooting plugs that I've tried. I've used one pair now for over a week. It's also a nice touch to have the flat end. That aids in easy removal of the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Happy

customer_reviews.title: Best for people with VERY small ears
customer_reviews.text: I always thought of myself as someone with small ears - when I get the different sizes of earbuds, I always choose the smallest one. I got these because they were slim and I didn't want too much pressure on my ears while sleeping. However, these are way too small! They hardly block out any sound! Kind of regret buying so many.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: For 200 pairs under $20, I'll gladly take a lifetime supply of my favorite disposables.
customer_reviews.text: If you have small ear canals like me, these are your earplugs. If you like better more comfortable earplugs, these are also them. If you like better sounding ear plugs, these seem to do that. Where most earplugs seem to work as a muffler as well as a highpass filter, these seem to not be so much of a high pass filter and any veteran concertgoer can tell you that you can adjust the level of sound reduction by slightly cocking the plug in your ear a bit. that still works with these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Cut some off
customer_reviews.text: These work well but are too long to go deeply in the ear canal - they "smush up" (especially after one use). I have found that cutting off about 25% makes them more stable and easier to insert without a loss in effectiveness !
customer_reviews.author: cartecay1

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Use these to sleep at night and they work amazing. There are still some sounds that get through, but it's WAY less than it used to be. I also prefer the corded ones because that way I'm not having to worry about the ear plugs getting lost and becoming cat toys/food
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Meeker

customer_reviews.title: The best in the world and cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are actually great, better than any other similar ones because they are a much more soft, compressible foam. The other ones are too big and dense and have trouble fitting. These are better than any of the ones on Tim Ferriss' blog. Better than silicon, or the ones with strings. I"ve been looking like 10 years! Plus they look like candy, and who can argue with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A must have for projects and chores.
customer_reviews.text: Better sound reduction and longer life than other ear plugs I've used. Not sure the other brands, but these are great and work after you squeeze them use them and repeat. I'm a convert from over the head type. These aren't as sound reducing, but that makes for safety about your surroundings and normal voices. Good on the tractor, using table saw, drills, hammering nails, and I'll try them sleeping next time I'm in a noisy spot.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J

product_meta.title: Howard Leight by Honeywell Laser Lite High Visibility Disposable Foam Earplugs, Pink/Yellow , 200-Pairs (LL-1) - 3301105
product_meta.description:
Style:200 Pairs| Pattern Name:EarplugsConfirm at a glance that employees and colleagues are wearing ear protection with Howard Leight by Honeywell Laser Lite High Visibility Disposable Foam Earplugs. The yellow and magenta color scheme ensure these foam earplugs stand out, even across a busy shop floor. The contoured T-shape makes for easy insertion and removal, and the self-adjusting foam is designed to fit most ear canals. Workplace dirt buildup is inhibited by the soil-resistant, closed-cell foam skin. 200 pairs of disposable earplugs per pack.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Laser Lite uncorded single-use earplugs are made of self-adjusting foam that expands to fit virtually every wearer. The contoured T-shape allows for easy insertion and fit. It's smooth, soil-resistant skin prevents dirt build-up. Vibrant colors make protection visible. Pairs are individually packaged in a polybag. NRR 32.
feature_bullets: LASER LITE HI-VIS COLORS: Vibrant yellow & magenta color is highly visible from a distance to help ensure employee compliance and hearing safety; it also helps prevent loss or misplacement
EXCELLENT NOISE REDUCTION (NRR 32): Self-Adjusting foam earplugs expand in the ear upon insertion to create a secure seal for excellent hearing protection in loud workplaces and jobsites
IDEAL FOR SMALLER & LARGER EARS: Small size of earplug delivers optimal fit and ear protection for smaller ears, but low pressure foam expands to fit virtually any size ear and ear canal
COMFORT & HYGIENE: Contoured T-shape allows for easy insertion and removal; Smooth, soil-resistant, closed-cell foam skin helps prevent dirt build-up; 200 pairs of earplugs per box
RECOMMENDED INDUSTRIES: farming, chemical, construction, law enforcement, manufacturing, military, mining, municipal, oil & gas, pharmaceutical, steel, metal, transportation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,542 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
